extendedInfo.description: * Add text note, take picture, import text message, add bookmarks to your library* Organize text note, picture, bookmarks etc into lists* Sync data with diigo.com* Mark webpages as "read later" in desktop browsers, then read it on the phone* Widget on the home screenFollow us @diigo Thx!

reviews.title: It\'s alright, but...
reviews.comment: Evernote is better & you can also use it on your computer and phone. I\'d check it out you\'ll be very impressed.  Power Note is ok, I did like the look of it & I didn\'t have any problems using it. I just don\'t see the need in having 2 apps that serve the same purpose & using up space.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Widget gone!
reviews.comment: Where did the widget go? I love this app. I would like to see the option to zoom in the photo when viewing my photo note.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Limited.
reviews.comment: Hasn\'t been updated in over a year despite well known limitations and flaws. Not full Diigo functionality.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cannot
reviews.comment: cache pages. Cannot share pages with groups. Cannot search bookmarks. Cannot see more than 10 of my bookmarks. Not updated in well over a year. Useless. I am a paying Diigo customer. The developer is not responding to contact.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Innovative
reviews.comment: The idea of Diigo Bookmark with features like annotation is great. But it wd be the best if Power Note cd communicate with the stock android browser; for example: directly bookmarking from the stock browser or at least importing bookmarks of stock android browser. Why the tagwise searching is absent? Hope to see these improvements in the upcoming versions. Wish u guys all the best. -- SGS2
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Internet Research Heaven
reviews.comment: For anyone who researches, this is the end all save all. The website combined with this app makes researching swift and even fun.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app for Diigo
reviews.comment: Would get 5 stars he I could add comments to my saved links
reviews.author: Darryl Schoeman

reviews.comment: Works ok, but seems a bit clumsy. Also, can\'t access my Diigo groups, so clearly needs some updating.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Superb website! But mobile app needs improvement!
reviews.comment: Okay for viewing the diigo library. However, looks as if diigo has paid very little attention to the mobile interfaces.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: JTJr
reviews.comment: Great App! It would get 5 stars if it could let me share to my Diigo groups.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Limited access to favorites
reviews.comment: I stumbled on this application trying to buy my way out of writing something similar myself-- just to be able to save and access my bookmarks from any browser or platform. Very great concept and that warrants 3 stars\357\274\233however, can only access most recent favorites... So  no more stars
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very useful, great customer service
reviews.comment: This app is super useful for accessing and adding items to your Diigo account (which itself is a super useful tool for organizing information you find online). The developers are also very responsive. I reported a sign-in problem, got great follow-up, and after less than two days they had released a new version on the Market to fix the issue.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs an update badly!
reviews.comment: Old UI. Diggo has apparently abandoned Android in favor of iOS...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No Google sign in with no warning & sync problem
reviews.comment: I am sorry that sign in using a Google account is no longer supported, but I am even sorrier that there was absolutely no warning about that.  Unfortunately this created sync problems that I have not yet been able to solve, even after I created a Diigo account.  Note that there are still Google sign in buttons all around....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: it could be much more better
reviews.comment: I have to use it although it doesn\'t display Cyrillic notes correctly, can\'t synchronize all content for offline usage (including personal lists) and have ugly interface.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good but..
reviews.comment: The ability to edit your notes in a non-HTML format would be nice. It gets really confusing. Also could have abetter UI. Other than that this app is great!
reviews.author: Alex Wohlbruck

reviews.title: Savior!
reviews.comment: Is very intuitive. Sync works like a charm. UI needs improvement. Still lags back to the eclair look. Otherwise, a dream.
reviews.author: Venkatesh Kumaravel

reviews.title: Simple bookmarklet with syncable library access
reviews.comment: It could be a lot better, but for now it\'s enough for me. Diigo is awesome \342\231\245
reviews.author: Z Kun

reviews.title: Chinese annotations on google Nexus 4
reviews.comment: Chinese characters in Quick Notes are good, in webpages are good, and in annotations are good on the PC. However, they are non sense in the android app. Maybe this is because of the decoding thing. Hope this bug be taken care of soon.  \344\270\255\346\226\207\346\263\250\351\207\212\345\234\250\345\256\211\345\215\223\347\250\213\345\272\217\344\270\255\346\230\276\347\244\272\344\270\272\344\271\261\347\240\201
reviews.author: Zheng Kang

reviews.title: Best thing ever.. worth it
reviews.comment: i tried several apps for note taking and all of them are the same in term of futures complications. This one is complementary unique and very user friendly and also simple. It can be integrated every where.
reviews.author: A Google User
